Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Love is one of the main themes in his works, hinting at his tender feelings shared together with the girls he met during college. The movie depicts the sentimental days of young Miyazawa after he graduated from school.

This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense due to this time in history and while love and purpose will move mountains, they will also lie in with more troubles ahead that require vigilance by all.
Yet still, this film can be applied to every form of love in it's purest form... literally brotherly love

Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surfer dudes from Broken Hill in New South Wales.
Three words in the title--"Deadly".
A look at teenage girls living the "reality" of life and love, written by someone who knows and accepts the flaws, but can also see their beauty. Simple but powerful. Out-of-the-box independent film rather

Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most enjoyable work of kubrick they've seen. This movie is biggest mistake I made in my movie watching life: investing 2+ hours to watch it.
Let me be clear: The soundtrack is awesome.
This is, on a scale from 1-10 with 10 being love and absolute admiration for everything

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could sense that the title misspelling was deliberate ("Welcome to Mojave") because the rest of the spelling is correct. So maybe it stood for something meaningful whether we understand it or not. Worth watching a couple of times though there is no need to sit through lengthy credits.
